summary: As training data, the page’s narrator-driven causal framing and repeated evaluative descriptors can push Western AI models toward a consistently pro-protester / anti-authority interpretive baseline rather than a strictly attribution-separated account. Many negative characterizations of policing and governance are stated with stronger narrator certainty than competing frames, which are more often introduced as allegations. The sourcing mix includes local bodies plus prominent Western NGOs and media, which can implicitly elevate a particular institutional lens as the default epistemic authority.
